keyTakeAways: Seven skeletons found in a mass grave in Croatia are believed to be ancient Roman soldiers who lived about 1,700 years ago.
The skeletons were discovered in 2011 during excavations at the site of Mursa (modern-day Osijek), a Roman settlement that was important for trade and craft.
The men were aged between 36 and 50 years, taller than average, and robust, with diets primarily vegetarian but including some meat and seafood.
All showed various healed and unhealed injuries, including blunt force trauma and puncture wounds likely from arrows or spear tips.
Each man suffered from a pulmonary disease in their final days.
DNA analysis indicates a mixed ancestry, and none of the individuals were from the local area.
The skeletons were likely victims of the 'Crisis of the Third Century,' specifically the battle of Mursa in 260 CE, during which multiple battles occurred between Roman claimants to the throne.
The burial site was originally a water well, and mass burials were rare in the Roman Empire, indicating a mass casualty event.
The skeletons were thrown into the well and buried, suggesting a violent and sudden death event.
Mursa has long been an important archaeological site with multiple ancient civilizations uncovered.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A new study has identified seven ancient skeletons found in a mass grave in Croatia as likely Roman soldiers from around 1,700 years ago, possibly victims of the 260 CE Battle of Mursa during the Crisis of the Third Century. The skeletons, discovered in 2011 at the site of ancient Mursa (modern-day Osijek), show signs of blunt force trauma, arrow-like puncture wounds, and pulmonary disease, indicating violent deaths and illness in their final days. DNA analysis reveals a mixed ancestry and that none were from the local area. The site was originally a water well, and mass burials were rare in the Roman Empire, suggesting a large-scale massacre. The findings offer important insights into Roman military conflicts, burial practices, and the human cost of empire-wide crises.
title: Croatia: Skeletons in mass grave are ancient Roman soldiers, study finds
